STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
February 9, 2021
Antoinette Prabucki
Isabella County DHHS
1919 Parkland Drive
Mount Pleasant, MI 48858
RE: License #: CP370201201
Isabella County DHHS
1919 Parkland Drive
Mount Pleasant, MI 48858
Dear Ms. Prabucki:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on February 5,
2021. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and
MISEP requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that
violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 For any repeat violation, why the prior corrective action plan failed to
achieve compliance.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Claudia Triestram at (616) 552-3662.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Stephanie Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 11
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12306 Application request.
(4) An agency shall document that the licensee has been given
an application for renewal of the license not less than 60
calendar days before the expiration date of the license.
Six foster home files were reviewed. One of three foster home files that required an
application 60 days prior to expiration received it 45 days prior to the expiration of
the license.
R 400.12311 Foster parent/agency agreement.
(3) An agency shall document review of the foster
parent/agency agreement with the foster family at least annually
and, when needed, develop a new agreement.
One of six foster home files reviewed did not have the foster parent/agency
agreement completed annually.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(a) Within 30 calendar days from removal from the home.
Six foster care files were reviewed. One of four initial service plans reviewed was
completed after the required 30 calendar days.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at
least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
Six foster care files were reviewed. Four of nine service plans did not have the
child’s treatment plan generated or saved as required.
4

2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the following:
ISEP 6.49 Medical Passport
The medical passport shall be updated quarterly.
One of six foster care files reviewed did not have medical passports updated
quarterly. This is a repeat violation from Renewal Inspection dated 2/1/2020
with a Corrective Action Plan dated 3/9/2020.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
FOM 722-03 Placement Exception Request
Placement Exception Request must be completed with siblings
are placed apart.
Six foster care cases were reviewed. One foster care case required a PER for a
sibling split and did not have one completed.
FOM 722-09 Supervisory Approval - USP
The caseworker’s supervisor must review, approval and sign the
updated service plan within fourteen days, after a face-to-face
meeting with the caseworker.
Six foster care files were reviewed. One of nine updated service plans reviewed was
not approved by the supervisor within the required timeframe.
FOM 722-06H Timely Entry of Caseworker Contacts
All face-to-face contacts must be entered in MiSACWIS within
five business days of the contact.
5

Four of six foster care files reviewed lacked timely entry of face-to-face contacts.
FOM 722-06I Maintaining Connections: Parenting time, Sibling Visitation,
and Contact
Six foster care files were reviewed. One foster care file required a parenting time
exception be completed which was not documented.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There was one incident of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during this
licensing period. There was one incident of substantiated corporal punishment
during this licensing period. The agency opened a special investigation and then
6

revoked the foster home license.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. The corrective action plan was in response
to the renewal inspection dated 2/1/2020 with the corrective action plan dated
3/9/2020. The agency has shown significant progress with the corrective action plan
only having one repeat citation during this inspection.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on a regular license.
____________________________________February 9, 2021
Stephanie Meeuwenberg Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
February 9, 2021
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
